alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 9:17AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cherry, northern Grant and east central Sheridan Counties through 900 AM MDT... At 817 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles northeast of Ellsworth, or 32 miles southeast of Rushville, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Hill, Dipping Vat Meadow, Wolf Hill, Argo Hill and Mother Lake. This includes Highway 61 between mile markers 166 and 181. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
